intro: Styrax vidalianus, commonly known as the Florida styrax, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its simple, opposite, ovate leaves that turn red in the fall. The plant produces fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters during late spring. Its bark is smooth and gray, with a distinctive aromatic scent when cut. Styrax vidalianus is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland areas.
